numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The data is based on more than 21000 people.
2. This large sample size increases the reliability of the data.
3. The overall mean percentage of 15- to 24-year-olds who say that the world is getting better with each generation is higher than 50%.
4. The overall mean percentage of people who are 40 years old or older and who say that the world is getting better with each generation is lower than 50%.
5. This data suggests that older generations may feel that their contribution to a more developed future was not enough.
6. This data also suggests that older generations may feel that recent generations will not receive better life conditions.
7. Such feelings could increase depression rates.
8. Such feelings could increase a negative outlook toward the future of humanity.
9. The data shows that younger generations are more optimistic about the world for future generations.
10. Younger perspectives about the future can create more hope.
11. Younger perspectives about the future can create greater aspirations for the future.
12. These aspirations can help the human race to improve in some aspects.
14. Indonesia is the most optimistic country in the data.
15. In Indonesia, both age ranges assume that the world is getting better with each generation.
17. The comment states that Mali is the most.
